channel.title: CSS Question
channel.description:
Is there a way to float an object to the bottom, specifically an image? Tried float:bottom; but it didn't work...
Thanks

item.title: CSS Question
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

That worked, thanks a ton!

item.title: CSS Question
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

try this

[code]

aaaaaaaaaa <style type="text/css" body{ background-color: #ABABAB; font-size: 11px; font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif; margin: 4px auto; text-align: center; } #wrapper{ width:672px; height: 100%; background: url("images/layout/middle.gif"); position: relative; } #wrapBot{ width:171; vertical-align: bottom; } img.blah{ position: absolute; bottom: 0; left:0; } </style

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: CSS Question
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Give us a link to what you’re working with, and by the way, float only works left or right. Not bottom.

Read full topic

item.title: CSS Question
item.dc:creator: @d_sign d_sign
item.description:
@d_sign wrote:

That aligns it way off to the right though…

Source:

<html>
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta http-equiv="Content-Language" content="en-us">
<title>aaaaaaaaaa</title>
<style type="text/css" </head>
body{
	background-color: #ABABAB;
	font-size: 11px;
	font-family: arial,helvetica,sans-serif;
	margin: 4px auto;
	text-align: center;
	}
#wrapper{
	width:672px;
	height: auto;
	height: 171px;
	min-height: 171px;
	background: url("images/layout/middle.gif");
	position: relative;
	}
#wrapBot{
	width:171;
    vertical-align: bottom;
	}
img.blah{
	position: absolute;
	bottom: 0%;
	}
</style
</head>
</head>

<body>
<div id="wrapper">
<img style="float:top;" src="images/layout/top.gif" width="672" height="39">

<img align="center" class="blah" src="images/layout/footer.gif" width="672" height="39">
</div>
</body>

</html>

Read full topic
